law.catch_line: The Authority consists of the following nine members:...

section.section:
The Authority consists of the following nine members:
seven members appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate; and
as ex officio members:
the Secretary; and
the Treasurer or the Comptroller, as the Governor designates.
An ex officio member may designate a representative to serve on the Authority.

text.section:
The appointed members shall:
have substantial experience in business or economic development; and
reflect the geographic, racial, ethnic, and gender makeup of the State.

section.section: The term of an appointed member is 5 years.
The terms of the appointed members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Authority on October 1, 2008.
At the end of a term, an appointed member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Governor may remove an appointed member with or without cause.
